content: For the Libs this must be a case of "Our King can spend more of our money than your king!" syndrome. The guy is wasting millions just to take his wife to a play, and they got nothing to say about that? The Helicopter or a small corporate-size jet could have done the job. Why a 150 ton flying limousine that take 20-30,000 pound of fuel just to get to altitude??? How many trips to Alaska would that fuel for my Ford diesel? Trips I can't take because my income is too low, and my taxes/fuel costs are too high??? Conserve fuel and cut America dependence on Foreign Oil - - What a @#$%$% hypocrite!! Wandering and Wondering

Paul Gill."

Paul Gill."

How many one day trips has President Obama gone on since he's taken office? If he keeps up this pace, he'll surpass the number of trips to Crawford that former President Bush took by far, possibly within his first year of office.
quote: Originally posted by BPCR45_90: quote: Originally posted by psychoABN: Another date night for the Obama's....This one in NYC....I wonder what the bill's going to be for this one? I don't recall anyone whining about the cost to the taxpayers for Bush's innumerable vacations to Crawford, Texas. This is pretty insignificant. We can't expect any First Family to be prisoners in the Whitehouse, nor can we expect them to incur the risks of using public transportation just to save a few bucks.
reply: I do believe that former President Bush actually worked and performed the duties of his office while at the ranch in Crawford. How many one day trips has President Obama gone on since he's taken office? If he keeps up this pace, he'll surpass the number of trips to Crawford that former President Bush took by far, possibly within his first year of office.
title: Date Night on Broadway: How much will it cost us?

content: That is not even in the same category of stupid politics...most President's have used AF One to go to and from home, meetings, etc. it is tradition..not to a football game, Broadway Play, etc. it is entirely different... If he had been "smart" he would have met with Mayor Blumberg and then gone to a play, or have the Mayor invite him to ground zero...something other than his using government property for his own use and entertainment. Anyone else would have been fired!

Bush took time to commend firefighters for their monthlong effort to battle the Day Fire that burned more than 250 square miles of Los Padres National Forest. Dressed in a dark suit and royal-blue tie, Bush was greeted on the airport tarmac by a delegation that included Los Angeles County Supervisor Michael Antonovich, Sheriff Lee Baca, Arcadia Mayor Roger Chandler, actor Bruce Boxleitner and retired Air Force Col. Paul Gill."

October 31, 2001 "President Bush threw out the ceremonial first pitch before Game 3 last night, the first president to do so at a World Series at Yankee Stadium in 45 years." "Two presidential helicopters landed in McCombs Dam Park, adjacent to Yankee Stadium, about 7:25 p.m., raising dust that drifted over the banks of lights in the ballpark on the third-base side. Another smaller helicopter arrived about five minutes later."

content: GRAYWOLFGHOST, NEVER EVER mention a president and a theater in Wash DC...Last one did not work out all that well. And the alternate is Biden, don't forget. May Mr. Obama have good health and lose the next election. And Take Joe with him into retirement. And, indeed,BCPR..., we all heard the shrill shrieking from the left every time Mr. Bush went to Crawford. My gosh, I thought my eardrums would burst at every newscast! Personally, I'm all for Mr. Obama and Mr. Biden taking the next 6 mos. off, say exploring Disney World etal. around Orlando, Fla.. Maybe things would sort themselves out as the normally do when political hacks arn't screwing things up.
